text: Xochitl Liana Torres Small (first name pronounced ; born November 15, 1984) is an American lawyer and politician who was the U.S. Deputy Secretary of Agriculture from 2023 until 2025. She was the U.S. Representative for from 2019 until 2021. She lost her 2020 re-election bid by Republican Yvette Herrell in a rematch of the 2018 congressional race. On June 18, 2021, it was announced that President Joe Biden would nominate Torres Small as Under Secretary for Rural Development at the United States Department of Agriculture. She was confirmed by voice vote on October 7, 2021. On February 15, 2023, President Biden announced his plan to nominate Torres Small for United States deputy secretary of agriculture. She was confirmed on July 11 in a 84â€“8 vote. ==References== Category:1984 births Category:Living people Category:Lawyers from New Mexico Category:United States representatives from New Mexico Category:Politicians from Portland, Oregon Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Lawyers from Portland, Oregon Category:People from Las Cruces, New Mexico
title: Xochitl Torres Small
